bibl.title: The Minimum Subject to the Vicesima Hereditatium.
bibl.note: Reproduit de: AJP 73 (1952) pp. 397-405. Discusses the evidence about the vicesima hereditatium, one of the taxes introduced by Augustus in A.D. 6 to support the aerarium militare. See pp. 402-404 = 102-104, on P. Mich. VII, 435 + 440 (=C.P.L. 219 + 190; Roman Mil. Rec. 77).

bibl.title: James Frank Gilliam, Roman Army Papers

bibl.seg: Gilliam James Frank, The Minimum Subject to the Vicesima Hereditatium.
James Frank Gilliam, Roman Army Papers = Mavors Roman Army Researches. 2 (Amsterdam, 1986) pp. 97-105.

Reproduit de: AJP 73 (1952) pp. 397-405. Discusses the evidence about the vicesima hereditatium, one of the taxes introduced by Augustus in A.D. 6 to support the aerarium militare. See pp. 402-404 = 102-104, on P. Mich. VII, 435 + 440 (=C.P.L. 219 + 190; Roman Mil. Rec. 77).
